column2: MISSOURI DMV TEST
column4: Missouri

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. The ‘One Way’ sign means that:
column4: drivers may travel only in the direction of the arrow.
column6: there is only one road that turns left at the intersection.
column8: only vehicles turning left may travel in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: 360 degree turn ahead.

column2: 3. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 4. Front door windows on a vehicle may be tinted to no more than ____ light blockage.
5. To help others know that you want to be an organ donor, you should:
column4: fill out the organ donor form on the back of your license.
column6: have two witnesses sign the back of your license.
column8: inform the local police department of your decision.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column10: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 8. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
column4: A reflective red square

column2: 9. Drivers with an intermediate license have the following driving restriction(s):
column4: A driving curfew from 1 AM to 5 AM.
column6: Seat belt must be worn by the driver.
column8: Seat belts must be worn by all passengers.

column2: 10. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 11. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column4: the left side

column2: 12. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: All of the above.
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column10: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Merge
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 15. FACT stands for:
column4: Fast Action Causes Trouble.
column6: Failure to Appear in Court for Traffic violations.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 17. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 18. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 19. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column4: On the crosswalk.

column2: 20. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a headlight failure.
column10: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 21. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column4: motorcycles are slower than cars.
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.
column10: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.

column2: 22. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column6: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 23. This warning sign:
column4: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.

column2: 24. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.

column2: 25. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.
column8: having them checked by a mechanic.
